column2: Targeted liability protections for pandemic and epidemic products and security countermeasures
column3: This section outlines the actions that may be taken after the declaration of a Public Health Emergency by the Secretary. After such a declaration, the Secretary may require the manufacture, development, testing, distribution, administration, and use of medical countermeasures (MCM). The Secretary must describe the following in the declaration: (A) threats to health for which the MCM may be used, (B) period of time in which the declaration is in effect, (C) Population(s) for which the administration and/or use of MCM is applied, (D) geographic areas for which the declaration is in effect, and (E) specifications for distributing and obtaining the MCM. Importantly, there is a provision related to the Strategic National Stockpile (SNS), which requires that, if the MCM is included in the Secretary's declaration, the declaration shall include a period when the MCM is administered or used with respect to distribution and/or release from the SNS.
